description: Numbers n such that 9090...9091 (with n-1 copies of 90 and one copy of 91) is prime.
references: J. A. H. Hunter and J. S. Madachy, Mathematical Diversions, New York: Dover Publications, Inc., 1974, pp. 4-5. Originally published by Van Nostrand, 1963.
links: D. Broadhurst, Proof that 1505 term is prime
author: Antreas P. Hatzipolakis (xpolakis(AT)otenet.gr), May 22 2000
extensions: More terms from _Michael Kleber_ and Harvey Dubner (harvey(AT)dubner.com), May 22, 2000
_Ignacio Larrosa Ca√±estro_ reports that the 1068 term has now been established to be a prime using Titanix 1.01, Oct 23 2000
